lines.text: [trying to decipher the lyrics to Jumpin' Jack Flash]
Mick, Mick, Mick! Speak English!
[Trying to decipher Jumpin' Jack Flash's lyrics]
I was raised by two lesbians? Come on, Mick. Fuck a duck!
Drag the river! There are killers running around the fucking city!
How would you like me to wash your mouth out with a wire brush?
How would you like if I kicked you in the nuts so hard they get lodged in your fucking nostrils?
My, that's a vivid image, isn't it?

[talking to a police detective who assumes she's a prostitute]
What is it with you people? Every time you see a black woman there has to be a pimp or a john? What, do you think there's a lot of work down on the pier for hookers? Do you think I'm giving blow jobs down there to goldfish?
Look, he's been shopping at Walgreens again. He's got his Brut collection.
Hey, at least I'm always ready for ladies.
Hey man, try some soap, you know?
I did. It got lonely.

[typing and speaking aloud]
What else can I do?
[NEED YOU TO CONTACT OTHER AGENTS]

[reading aloud]
"Need other c - " Are you crazy? You need more contacts? I work at a bank!

[typing aloud]
Who?

[reading aloud]
"First go to my apartment in New York and get something for me." God, what do you need? A trenchcoat? A camera? Microfilm! Ooh, ooh...

[typing aloud]
What?

[reading aloud]
"A frying pan." I'd have probably thought about that next.
I'm a little black woman in a big silver box. On the top of it it says "phone".

[screams]
Help!
Do the world a favor! Get yourself an office! With a desk! And a lamp!

[into phone]
You want a quarter? Kiss my ass! Find me in New York for this fucking quarter!
[at a spa]
What the fuck are you running here, Wild Kingdom?
Do you mean you're a civilian? You don't know anything about this, do you?
I don't know *dick* about this! Except some guy calling himself "Jumpin' Jack Flash" taps into my computer! Tells me I gotta go to his house and get a frying pan! To call Van Halen... Van Morrison...
Van Meter.
...Van Meter!
Is she on some kind of medication?
Not that I know of. Are you on some kind of medication?
Marty! You know, you can talk directly to me, asshole.

[noticing Terry's dress, which has recently been partially run through a shredder]
Am I just square, or is there something wrong with your dress?

[glares at him]
I got moths. Big, mutant, junkie *moths*!
Jesus, Terry. You got a dead guy, you got cops, you got your apartment trashed... what are you getting involved in? What are you doing?
I'm... winging it!

[exasperated]
Oh, you're winging it!
Yes, I'm winging it, Marty!
Well, that's great!
Why, thank you!
[She herds him out the door]
Terry...
[She slams the door in his face]

I've just had several of the worst days in my young life, Mr. Page, and the last thing I need is some jighead like you to be screaming at me in a whiny voice. If you don't leave me alone, I'm gonna snatch this badboy off your head
[pulls off Page's toupee, he gasps]
and ram it up your ol' chocolate whizway.
Dog's barking, can't fly without umbrella.
[first lines]
59 is a brisk 39 degrees. Next news and weather again at eight o'clock. Now back to the hits on New York's "more music" station.
There is a dead man, floating around in the river!

[after shootout ensues and the criminals are apprehended]
Anything you want me to tell Jack?
Yeah. You can tell him not to forget our date.
All this is for a date?
30 in the morning on the docks. I should just pin a hundred dollar bill to my ass and scream "Victim here! Victim here!"
I didn't know that's what happens when you put Ex-Lax in tea.
[Terry comes in wielding a gun]
Do you want a hostage? I've been trained to be a hostage.
[Terry cuts off the Russian video from her computer monitor]
You should have left it on. It's almost time for "Leave it to Brezhnev."
No, it's not. It's time for "Gilligan's Gulag."

[to his thugs]
Don't kill her.
No, no. Don't kill me. You're right.
She's worthless dead.
Listen to the man.
We've got to be sure.
That's right, Mr. Talbot.
So shoot her in the legs.

[while she is drugged with truth serum]
Look what they did to this woman - she looks *terrible*!
It's a man.
Do you know what a pawn is?

[sarcastically]
Yes, it's a shrimp.
That's a prawn. A pawn...
...is the smallest piece on the chessboard!
And the most expendable.
Amateur night, Miss Doolittle, is over. Get off the stage before you get carried off.
Knock knock.
Leave me alone.
I'm sorry. Unavoidably delayed in London. Queen thanks you.

[typing]
Frankly, I don't give a shit about the queen. I did give a shit about you, however. I sat in that restaurant feeling stupid. And hurt.

[stops typing]
I mean, what happened to you? All you had to do was come and say "hi" or "thanks" or something. I mean you just left me sitting there. But no, you sent me to a restaurant with shitty bread sticks.
Sorry. I still want to to take you to dinner.

[typing]
Next time I'm in London, I'll look you up.
Liz! Liz! Liz! KGB!
Not in front of the kids!
Can I write "KGB" on the cake?
No, you may not.

[after toupee is ripped off]
Get Larry the Heavyset Guard. Get Larry the Heavyset Guard...
[while she is being chased by thugs]
I got diseases... I got shit that will make your dick fall off!
